availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Allison "Woodville" Pollard (Caldwell County, farm laborer and 2nd Lieut. 17th Ky Cav)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Louis Pollard and Sallie Davis Pollard. Farm laborer in Pollards Tan Yard, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from April 30, 1865, to September 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Pollards Tan Yard, p. 151.
"Allison Woodville "Wood" Pollard (1837-1914)," Find A Grave, Memorial #154988858, accessed August 11, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/154988858.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #18.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 418.
